activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Paul Horbinski

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
3:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew Paul Horbinski appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Andrew Paul Horbinski. Calling 21CM194 & 22CF978. 22CF97 set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Svehlek/Pfeifer/Court statement to bond. Court clarifies Defendant's address. Court sets signature bond in 22CF97. adj. 03:58 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Paul Horbinski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Andrew Paul Horbinski. Calling 22CF97 & 21CM194. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - 22CF97 set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. adj. 02.39 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
